translated: Praise of the Three Bodies of the Buddha, composed by the sages of the Western RegionsğŸ”½Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions, Chao-san-ta-fu Shih-kuang-lu
Qing Ming-jiao Ta-shi, subject Fa-xian, translated by imperial decree
I now bow my head to the Buddha of the Dharma Body, whose universal wisdom is incomparable and inconceivable,
Filling the Dharma realm without obstruction, tranquil and still, unequaled,
Neither existent nor nonexistent, the true nature, also neither more nor less, free from quantity,
Equal, signless, like empty space, the blessings and benefits for oneself and others are also like this.
I now bow my head to the Buddha of the Retribution Body, who abides peacefully in the great sage,
Compassionately transforming and liberating the assembly of bodhisattvas, illuminating everywhere like the sun in the assembly,
Accumulating merit and virtue for three asaá¹ƒkhyeya kalpas, only then able to perfect the tranquil path,
With a great voice expounding the wonderful Dharma, universally causing attainment of the equal fruition.
I now bow my head to the transformation body Buddha, who attained perfect enlightenment under the Bodhi tree,
Sometimes manifesting changes or tranquility, or going to transform in the ten directions,
Either turning the Dharma wheel in the Deer Park, or manifesting great light like a mass of fire,
Able to eliminate the suffering retributions of the three evil paths, the incomparable great sage in the three realms.
Such a Buddha body of untainted wisdom, I always believe and understand, purifying the three karmas,
With immeasurable wisdom and great meritorious practices, single-mindedly compassionate towards all beings,
Praising the three bodies of the Buddha with these verses, the seeds of untainted merit and virtue I have obtained,
I vow to quickly realize Buddhahood, leading all beings to return to the right path.
Praise of the Three Bodies of the Buddha
